Class Answer

java.lang.Object
application.Answer
public class Answer extends Object
Represents an answer to a question in a QandA application. This class manages the answer's content, author, voting statistics, and correctness status.

  • Constructor Details

    • Answer

      public Answer(String text, String answeredBy)
      Constructs a new Answer with the specified text and author. New answers start with zero votes and are not marked as correct.
      Parameters:
      text - The text content of the answer
      answeredBy - The name or identifier of the person providing the answer

  • Method Details

    • getText

      public String getText()
      Gets the text content of this answer.
      Returns:
      The answer's text content

    • setText

      public void setText(String text)
      Updates the text content of this answer.
      Parameters:
      text - The new text content

    • getAnsweredBy

      public String getAnsweredBy()
      Gets the name or identifier of the person who provided this answer.
      Returns:
      The answerer's name or identifier

    • setAnsweredBy

      public void setAnsweredBy(String answeredBy)
      Updates the name or identifier of the person who provided this answer.
      Parameters:
      answeredBy - The new answerer's name or identifier

    • getUpvotes

      public int getUpvotes()
      Gets the number of upvotes this answer has received.
      Returns:
      The count of upvotes

    • getDownvotes

      public int getDownvotes()
      Gets the number of downvotes this answer has received.
      Returns:
      The count of downvotes

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Gets the unique identifier for this answer.
      Returns:
      The answer's ID

    • setId

      public void setId(int id)
      Sets the unique identifier for this answer.
      Parameters:
      id - The new ID value

    • upvote

      public void upvote()
      Increments the upvote count by one.

    • downvote

      public void downvote()
      Increments the downvote count by one.

    • setUpvote

      public void setUpvote(int upvote)
      Sets the upvote count to a specific value.
      Parameters:
      upvote - The new upvote count

    • setDownvote

      public void setDownvote(int downvote)
      Sets the downvote count to a specific value.
      Parameters:
      downvote - The new downvote count

    • isCorrect

      public boolean isCorrect()
      Checks if this answer has been marked as correct.
      Returns:
      true if the answer is marked as correct, false otherwise

    • markAsCorrect

      public void markAsCorrect()
      Marks this answer as correct. Once marked as correct, the status cannot be reverted in the current implementation.

    • hasReview

      public boolean hasReview()
      Marks this answer as reviewed. Once marked as reviewed, the status cannot be reverted in the current implementation.
      Returns:
      bool depending on when it's reviewed or not
